headline: Eid-el-Fitr: Lagos makes a U-turn, cancels Wednesday holiday
summarized_story:

The government also told workers in the Centre of Excellence to disregard its earlier circular which approved three straight days as public holidays.

headline: Eid-el-Fitri: Kogi CP assures of hitch-free celebration
summarized_story:
The Kogi State Commissioner of Police, Edward Egbuka, has assured members of the public of a hitch-free Eid-el-Fitri celebration.
The Commissioner, in a statement through the command Public Relations Officer, SP William Ovye Aya, on Friday ordered watertight security across the state before, during and after the celebrations.
Egbuka, who met with senior officers of the command in Lokoja charged all Area Commanders, Tactical and Operational Commanders as well as the Divisional Police Officers to beef up security within their areas of responsibility and to ensure massive deployment of patrol teams along the major highway and undercover operations to black spots, flashpoints, and other vulnerable criminal spots to nip in the bud all forms of crimes and criminality across the state.
While felicitating with Muslims on the occasion of 2022 Eid-el-Fitri, the statement added that “the Commissioner of Police reiterates the Command’s level of preparedness, determination and commitment in synergy with other security agencies in ensuring safety of lives and property”.

headline: Buhari to court: Electoral Act 84 (12) unconstitutional
summarized_story:
By Yusuf Alli and Eric Ikhilae, AbujaSection 84(12) of the Electoral Act 2022 cannot stand, President Muhammadu Buhari and the Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) Abubakar Malami (SAN) told a court yesterday.
President Buhari and Malami’s position is contained in a joint counter-affidavit they filed in the suit numbered FHC/ABJ/CS/247/2022 by the PDP.
They added that they had never taken it upon themselves to declare Section 84(12) or any provision of the Electoral Act, 2022 unconstitutional, as such a declaration was beyond their constitutional powers.
“Section 84(12) of the Electoral Act, 2022 is inconsistent with Sections 1(3), 42, 65, 66 particularly sections 66 (1) (f), 106 and 107 of the Constitution.

headline: Zenith Bank’s Growth Accelerates with 22% Rise in Gross Earnings in Q1
summarized_story:

Oboh said it is a known fact that the predominant occupation of the people in Esan land is farming, adding that due to the high level of insecurity in that region, they have ceased to go to their farms.

headline: 2023: Why I’m no longer interested in Nigeria’s politics – Elliot Uko
summarized_story:
Evangelist Elliot Ugochukwu-Uko, founder of Igbo Youth Movement (IYM) and secretary of Eastern Consultative Assembly (ECA) has said he is not interested in Nigeria’s politics of 2023, because another election is not the solution to the country’s problems.
I’m not interested in accommodation within the system nor access to power and patronage.

I am greatly embarrassed by the greed for power, and self entered thoughtlessness of ex President Jonathan, who is willing to crush the South East dream after all we did for him.

headline: 2023: Bayelsa govt distances self as Diri’s aide opposes Jonathan’s alleged power bid
summarized_story:
The government of Bayelsa State has distanced itself from the views shared by Daniel Alabrah, Governor Douye Diri’s Chief Press Secretary, in an article of former president, Goodluck Jonathan’s alleged presidential bid.
Alabrah, had in the said article opposed the alleged presidential bid by Jonathan, noting that it would shortchange the entire southern Nigeria.
Jonathan who completed his first term as president of Nigeria in 2015, would only hold office for an additional one term if elected president.
Alabrah said in the online article, “My personal view is that another Goodluck Jonathan presidency will shortchange the whole southern Nigeria.
His views are not, cannot, and should not be attributed to the Governor and the Government of Bayelsa State.

headline: TotalEnergies to exit Nigeria’s onshore oilfields, blames disruptions
summarized_story:
Oil major, TotalEnergies has announced plans to sell its minority stake in a Nigerian oil joint venture, joining other top firms divesting from onshore oilfields in the country.
Shell, the operator of the licences, is already considering bids from four local firms for its 30 per cent shareholding in the company.
In May 2021, Shell said it has started discussions with the federal government to sell its onshore oil assets in Nigeria.
The company would join the league of foreign oil companies exiting the Nigerian oil market after operating in the market for over 60 years.
International oil companies (IOCs) intend to focus on deep-water fields due to the operational difficulties — including sabotage — experienced on onshore fields.

headline: 2023: Buhari vows to protect votes, warns global community against interference
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s president, Muhammadu Buhari, has cautioned against foreign interference in the 2023 general elections in the country, just as he assured of his commitment to ensure that votes count.
“As you’re all aware, the tenure of this Administration ends on 29th May, 2023.
Typical of election years all over the world, the tempo of political activities is often high,” he said.
I’m committed to bequeathing a stronger culture of credible elections to Nigeria than I met.
On COVID-19, Buhari restated Nigeria’s demand for vaccine equity and waiver of patents for manufacturing vaccines and approved drugs to treat the highly infectious disease.

headline: PDP Guber Aspirant, Dagogo, Arrested At Screening Venue In Rivers
summarized_story:
A member of the House of Representatives and Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) governorship aspirant in Rivers State, Hon.
Farah Dagogo, has been arrested at the South-South zonal secretariat of the party in Port Harcourt.
Recall that Dagogo, who represents Bonny/Degema federal constituency, was declared wanted by Governor Nyesom Ezenwo Wike on Wednesday evening for allegedly hiring suspected cultists to attack the state PDP secretariat in Port Harcourt.

headline: Federal Govt Declares Monday, Tuesday Public Holiday To Mark Worker’s Day, Eid-el-Fitr
summarized_story:
The federal government has declared Monday and Tuesday, May 2 and 3, 2022 as work-free day to mark this year’s Worker’s Day and Eid-el-Fitr celebrations.
This was announced by the minister of interior, Ogbeni Rauf Aregbesola, in a statement signed by the permanent secretary, Ministry of Interior, Dr. Shuaib Belgore.
The minister ongratulated workers across the country on this year’s celebration, while also commending them for their hard work, diligence and sacrifice to the nation’s growth and development.
In the same vein, the federal government through the minister also congratulated all Muslims for their successful completion of the holy month of Ramadan.
Aregbesola wished all Muslims a happy Eid-ul-Fitr celebration and prayed that the peace, blessings and favours of Allah be with all.

headline: 2 Chibok Girls Who Escaped From Boko Haram Bag Master’s Degree
summarized_story:
Two Chibok schoolgirls, who escaped from Boko Haram terrorists after their abduction alongside over 200 other schoolgirls in Chibok, Borno State on April 14, 2014, have bagged Master’s degree.
Joy Bishara and Lydia Pogu will receive master’s degree from Florida’s Southeastern University on Friday.
It could be recalled that on April 14, 2014, 276 pupils of Government Girls Secondary School, Chibok, Borno State, were kidnapped by the Boko Haram insurgents.
Bishara and Pogu received bachelor’s degree in the fall of 2021.
A release from the institution said Pogu will receive a master’s in Human Services during Friday’s graduation ceremony, and Bishara will receive a master’s degree in Social Work, reports The Ledger based in Lakeland Florida.

headline: Breaking: High profile football agent is dead
summarized_story:
High-profile football agent Mino Raiola has died at the age of 54 following a battle with lung disease.
Raiola represented the likes of Paul Pogba, Erling Haaland and Zlatan Ibrahimovic.
Back in January, Raiola underwent checks in Italy after reports said he was rushed to hospital for surgery.
German newspaper BILD said he was intensive care due to a lung disease, although his spokesperson downplayed the visit, saying: ‘Mino Raiola is undergoing the usual medical examinations that require anesthesia.
A promising footballer growing up, Raiola took over the reins as the head of HFC Haarlem’s youth team aged just 20 in 1987 before beginning his career as a football agent.

headline: MTNN, Pan-Atlantic University launch media innovation programme
summarized_story:
By Kehinde Ibrahim, LagosMTN Nigeria and Pan-Atlantic University (PAU), yesterday, announced the launch of the MTN Media Innovation Programme (MTN MIP), which will be run by PAU’s School of Media and Communication (SMC).
The six-month, fully funded fellowship for Nigerian media practitioners is designed to support the sustainable development of the nation’s changing media scene.
It is open to media practitioners across the spectrum, including print, electronic, online platforms and social media content creators.
Thus, it is only fitting that we support developments in the Nigerian media space with our infrastructure and enable capacity building initiatives to enable innovation in media practice.
The MTN Media Innovation Programme could not have come at a better time for Nigerian media practitioners to imbibe these pertinent values,” Professor Enase Okonedo, Vice Chancellor, Pan-Atlantic University, added.

headline: NCC moves to strengthen colocation, infrastructure sharing market segment
summarized_story:
By Asuelimen OsasuyiNigerian Communications Commission, NCC, has commenced the process of conducting a study to assess the current level of competition in the colocation and infrastructure sharing, CIS, segment of the Nigerian telecommunications sector.
According to NCC, seventy-eight licensees are currently operating in that market segment.
The NCC takes this issue as priority in view of the critical role played by the colocation and infrastructure sharing segment of the telecom ecosystem in ensuring robust services.
For instance, at the time the 2013 study was conducted, the CIS market segment was still at embryonic stage and as such, much emphasis was not placed on it.
The Director PCEA also informed that activities in the CIS market have also attained the targets set out in the Nigerian National Broadband Plan (2020-2025)”.

That is against the spirit and the letters of the constitution.”‘Not For The Rich’Falana’s comment comes on the heels of debates about the prices for nomination forms by the APC.

headline: Bitcoin Not A Panacea For Africa’s Economic Woes – IMF
summarized_story:
Bitcoin is not a cure-all for Africa’s economic woes, the International Monetary Fund warned Thursday, after the Central African Republic adopted the cryptocurrency as legal tender.
“It is really important to not see such things as a panacea” for the challenges that countries face, he said.
The Central African Republic has become the second country in the world to adopt bitcoin as official currency after El Salvador, which did so last year.
It is among six central African countries that share the CFA franc — a regional currency that is backed by France and pegged to the euro.
Other countries have already initiated legislative processes to adopt bitcoin, according to the specialised site Coinmarketcap.com.

headline: Man Utd Manager Ralf Rangnick Named Austria Coach
summarized_story:
Manchester United manager Ralf Rangnick has been appointed coach of Austria’s national team, the federation said Friday, but he will continue in a consultancy role at the club.
Rangnick joined United as interim manager in November last year and will move into an advisory position after Ajax coach Erik ten Hag comes in as the new permanent manager.
The 63-year-old German “will combine the job with his consultancy role at Old Trafford as planned,” United said in a statement.
The Austrian federation said Rangnick had been given a two-year deal that will be extended to four years if he secures qualification for the 2024 European championship.
“We are very pleased that in Ralf Rangnick we have been able to attract an outstanding expert in international football,” Austrian federation president Gerhard Milletich said.

headline: AGF Abubakar Malami declares intention to contest as Governor of Kebbi State -

The Minister said “Since you want me to contest governorship position of the state, I hereby accept your demand since you want me to do so.
“People from the state have been pressurising me to contest the governorship position in 2023.
His declaration to run for the Governorship position in the State now has put paid to all insinuations and rumours of his ambition for 2023.
He is seeking to succeed current governor, Abubakar Atiku Bagudu, who is in his second term as governor.

headline: Musk Sells $4bn in Tesla Shares, Presumably for Twitter Deal
summarized_story:
Elon Musk has sold 4.4 million shares of Tesla stock worth roughly $4 billion, most likely to help fund his purchase of Twitter.
The world’s richest man, who is the CEO of Tesla, tweeted that he doesn’t plan any further sales of the company’s shares.
Most of the sales took place on Tuesday, when Tesla shares closed down 12%, a huge single-day drop.
Analysts said Tesla investors fear Musk will be distracted by Twitter and less engaged in running the electric car company.
Tesla shares closed Thursday down slightly at $877.51.

headline: Kaduna Train Attack: Terrorists Release Picture of Baby Delivered in Captivity
summarized_story:
The picture of a new-born baby girl delivered in a terrorists’ den by a woman abducted during the March 28 attack on an Abuja-Kaduna-bound train has been released by the abductors.
The terrorist group suspected to be Ansaru, a breakaway group from Boko Haram, released the picture on Wednesday night.
ARISE News had reported the birth of the baby by the abductee in the terrorists’ den.
A family member of the woman had first hinted that she had been delivered of her baby, although the identity of the new-born child was not disclosed until the terrorists released her picture.
Nine persons, including a young medical doctor, were killed during the attack, with scores injured and over 60 passengers kidnapped.
